models.Tool: A function-calling capability that agents can invoke, with parameters, documentation, and usage information.
models.ToolParameter: A parameter that a tool accepts, including name, type, required status, and description.
models.ToolPackage: An npm package that provides one or more tools, with version info and install status.
models.EnvironmentVariable: A workspace-level configuration value (API keys, endpoints, secrets) used by tools.
models.UsageReference: A reference to where a tool is used in the prompt library (fragment or directory level).

relationships: Tool belongs to one ToolPackage (built-in tools have a special '@domainsmith/core' package)
Tool has many UsageReferences showing where it's used in the prompt library
Tool may have many EnvironmentVariables it depends on
EnvironmentVariable is used by one or more Tools

tools.name: Web Search
tools.description: Searches the web for current information using a configured search engine API. Returns relevant snippets with sources.
tools.documentation: Executes a web search using the configured search provider and returns formatted results with titles, snippets, and URLs. Best used for retrieving up-to-date information that may not be in the training data.

tools.name: File Read
tools.description: Reads the contents of a file from the allowed file system paths. Supports text files, markdown, JSON, and other plain text formats.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Absolute or relative path to the file

tools.documentation: Reads file contents from allowed paths. Returns the full file content as a string. Binary files will return an error. Use relative paths when possible for better portability.

tools.name: HTTP Request
tools.description: Makes HTTP requests to external APIs and services. Supports GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, and PATCH methods with custom headers and body.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to send the request to

tools.documentation: Executes HTTP requests to external APIs. Returns the response status, headers, and body. Supports JSON request/response handling. Time out after 30 seconds by default. Note: Sensitive credentials should be stored in environment variables, not hardcoded in requests.

tools.name: Database Query
tools.description: Executes read-only SQL queries against configured database connections. Useful for fetching structured data from PostgreSQL, MySQL, or SQLite databases.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: Name of the database connection to use

tools.documentation: Executes read-only SQL queries. Only SELECT statements are allowed for safety. Query results are returned as an array of objects. Connection must be pre-configured in the workspace settings.

tools.name: Date Calculator
tools.description: Performs date and time calculations including date differences, date arithmetic, timezone conversions, and date formatting.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Operation type: add, subtract, diff, format, convert

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: Unit: days, weeks, months, years, hours, minutes

tools.documentation: Performs common date operations. Supports ISO 8601 date strings and natural language parsing. Date arithmetic can add or subtract days, weeks, months, years, hours, or minutes. Timezone conversions use IANA timezone identifiers.

tools.name: Code Execution
tools.description: Safely executes Python code snippets in a sandboxed environment. Useful for data processing, calculations, and running analysis scripts.
tools.documentation: Executes Python code in an isolated sandbox with standard libraries available. Returns stdout, stderr, and the return value. Execution is limited to 60 seconds maximum. Network and filesystem access are restricted.

tools.name: Email Send
tools.description: Sends emails using configured SMTP settings. Supports HTML and plain text emails with attachments.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Email body content (HTML or plain text)

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: List of file paths to attach

tools.documentation: Sends emails using the configured SMTP server. HTML emails should include proper DOCTYPE and html tags. Attachments must be accessible file paths. Returns message ID on success.

tools.name: JSON Validator
tools.description: Validates JSON data against a JSON Schema. Returns detailed validation errors with locations and descriptions.
tools.documentation: Validates JSON against JSON Schema draft 7. Returns valid status and array of validation errors if any. Each error includes the path, expected type, and message.
